Author: George Orwell
Summary: In a totalitarian state under constant surveillance, Winston Smith dreams of truth and freedom. His forbidden love and rebellion bring hope, but betrayal and oppression crush him. A chilling tale of control and individuality.

Title: The Hobbit
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Summary: Bilbo Baggins, a quiet hobbit, is pulled into a quest with dwarves and Gandalf. They journey to reclaim treasure from Smaug, facing trolls, goblins, and danger. A tale of courage, friendship, and unexpected heroism.

Title: To Kill a Mockingbird
Author: Harper Lee
Summary: Scout Finch grows up in the racially divided South while her father defends a black man wrongly accused. Through innocence and courage, the story explores justice, prejudice, and empathy.

Title: Pride and Prejudice
Author: Jane Austen
Summary: Elizabeth Bennet navigates class, family, and pride in her encounters with the aloof Mr. Darcy. Misunderstandings give way to love in this witty and timeless social commentary.

Title: The Great Gatsby
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
Summary: Jay Gatsby throws lavish parties to win back Daisy Buchanan. Narrated by Nick Carraway, the novel reveals illusions, ambition, and loss in the Jazz Age. A critique of the American Dream.

Title: Moby Dick
Author: Herman Melville
Summary: Sailor Ishmael joins Captain Ahab’s obsessive hunt for Moby Dick, the great white whale. The voyage blends adventure with philosophy and danger. A tale of obsession, fate, and nature.

Title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher’s Stone
Author: J.K. Rowling
Summary: Harry Potter discovers he is a wizard and begins studies at Hogwarts. With friends Ron and Hermione, he faces dangers tied to the Philosopher’s Stone. A magical journey of friendship and courage.

Title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Summary: Frodo Baggins inherits the One Ring and joins a fellowship to destroy it in Mount Doom. Their journey is full of peril, betrayal, and courage in a battle against Sauron’s power.

Title: Brave New World
Author: Aldous Huxley
Summary: In a future society, humans are engineered and controlled for stability. Individuality and emotions are suppressed. When a ‘Savage’ challenges the system, its values collapse.

Title: The Catcher in the Rye
Author: J.D. Salinger
Summary: Holden Caulfield wanders New York after being expelled from school. Struggling with grief and disillusionment, he questions adulthood and innocence. A defining story of teenage rebellion.
